It is very sad to see the attitude of some Sri Lankans about Mr. Muralitharan coaching Australians. Is he the only Sri Lankan who has been a coach for an opposing team? How many Australian have been coaches for the Sri Lankans? what is shown is IDIOTIC pseudo PATRIOTISM by those who criticise Mr. Muralitharan. We or rather I salute you for the service you rendered for Sri Lankan cricket and for being a true gentlemen with great sportsmanship to offer your expertise to Australians.

I fully agree with you. After retiring from criket Murali is a free man. He can decide his future. Further, In Sri Lanka we don't have any rules banning retired professionals working in the same field after retirement.

My Hearty Congratulations!  I cant remember the year , but when Niroshan Bandarathilake was in the team. Sri Lanka won the Match. Murali & Niroshan both ran to the wicket at the same time. I saw that it is Murali who touched it first, however he allowed Niroshan to remove it with a smile. That's how a senior treated a junior and a new comer. From that date I have a very kind attitude towards him Murali.  May the "Triple Gem Bless You dear Murali!

Are you living in this world? Why should anybody, charity is somebody's own decision under his own capacity. Nowadays people only heard of money not charity. For e.g. Nanda Malini started her own academy, President Premadasa started 'Gam Udawa'. Somebody started 'Mahapola'. Lions club started many charity projects, myself at my young age started filling water holes at our by lane. That is my capacity. Many charity projects done without publicity.
Do you know how much charitable work he has done? He has done a lot more filling water holes - Galle cricket academy etc.
Also understand charity is calculated based on Mental pureness that you can't see by looking at the face or counting the number of times.

You are sure from "pita". Do you know how king of the Gods "Shakra" got this post. When he was human filling water holes, making roads for the comfort of people, digging wells for drinking water etc was his favorite charity. This charity made him not only god but also king of gods with many extraordinary powers. I never heard that playing cricket made anybody special in their next life.
